page.title: 17Dishley Mill-N.W.Lough.
page.content: {The Old Dishley Mill}is situated by the{Black Brook,}Derby Road,North West Loughborough.It no longer functions as a mill,for the wheelhouse has been removed and the building converted, in the early{1950s,}into a private home. Some of the{grindstones}remain and are used as decorations.An old chimney,an ornate front door and old Elizabethan beams have also been retained. The mill, dating back to the{sixteenth century,has had extensive alterations. The back wall has been knocked out and replaced with french windows,the drive is now set with pebbles and a large swimming pool has been constructed in the back garden.The adjoining pond has been drained.At one time the mill was associated with{Robert Bakewell,}the agricultural pioneer.Ducks frequent the area and breed on the nearby banks of the brook.
